visualization_prompt: Generate a 3D column chart showing monthly sales trends using synthetic business data. Technical requirements: Dark blue title (#00008B), 12-month categorical x-axis with 12px labels, y-axis sales metrics with 12px labels, custom color palette ['#008FFB','#00E396','#FEB019','#FF4560','#775DD0'], white background, bottom-aligned legend, and 3D depth effects.
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 12 monthly observations of synthetic sales figures (univariate time series). Synthetic values follow retail seasonality patterns with Q4 peaks (Nov=182.4K, Dec=208.9K) and summer dips (Jul=121.8K), maintaining μ=122.8K and σ=47.2K variance. The 3D column chart emphasizes relative monthly performance while minimizing perspective distortion through controlled alpha/beta angles. Cairo's principles are applied through: 1) Pre-attentive color coding using sequential blues for low months and warm hues for peak periods, 2) Direct labeling avoiding legend lookup for monthly data, 3) Tuftean data-ink optimization by using subtle gridlines only on y-axis. Statistical validity is maintained through synthetic data that replicates real-world sales distributions (positive skew=0.71, kurtosis=-0.33).
